lines.text: I'm dead aren't I? Where the hell am I? You God?
You're not a religious man are you, Mr Dean?
No but, I did plan to get very religious just before I died. You know, just in case
Left it a bit late, didn't I?
Hmmm. Let me put it in language you'll understand. You're on probation, Mr Dean. Think of me as your probation officer
I've been through your sheet, Mr Dean. You have a criminal record that started when you were none years old
Yeah, well... I don't suppose I can lie to you, Sir
You can try. You're almost a mystery. In your entire life you did nothing but take. Yet at the end you gave the noblest gift; you gave your life for another being
Well it seemed like the right thing to do at the time
Rubbish! It was instinct. If you'd had time to think you wouldn't have done it. Nevertheless, your instinct has earned you another chance. Probation, Mr Dean
You will go back and dedicate yourself to helping others. Giving not taking. You will become an Angel of Mercy
Probationary. Strictly on a trial basis. You will not speak of this incident to anyone.
Your honour, does this happen all the time when people get sent back to help out?
From time to time, worthy people are chosen to be Angels of Mercy. But these are difficult times, Mr Dean. In this century you're the first scumbag we've sent back
Scumbag? That's a bit much, isn't it? Scumbag?
